multi_add_portrait;Duessel;MidLeft;Knoll;MidRight
speak;Duessel;Knoll, if I may ask...|What exactly was your position in Grado's court?|I've seen you studying those tomes at all hours.
speak;Knoll;I was a researcher in the imperial magic academy.|My focus was primarily on ancient magic and its applications.
speak;Knoll;His majesty, Vigarde allowed our research team certain... freedoms.|We explored magical frontiers that many would consider forbidden.
speak;Duessel;I see.|King Vigarde always did have a keen interest in scholarship.|Though I admit, the magical arts have always been somewhat mysterious to me.
speak;Duessel;Give me a good lance or axe, and I know exactly what to do.|But magic? Incantations and rituals?|I'm afraid I lack the talent entirely.
speak;Knoll;With respect, General Duessel, I don't believe that's true.|Magic isn't merely an innate talent one is born with.
speak;Knoll;Anyone can learn the fundamentals with proper study and practice.|It's a discipline, much like swordsmanship or tactics.
bop_portrait;Duessel
speak;Duessel;Is that so?|I've always been under the impression that one must have a certain... affinity for it.
speak;Knoll;That is a common misconception.|Though I should warn you, magic is not to be taken lightly.
speak;Knoll;The power to manipulate the fundamental forces of nature...|It can be intoxicating, even dangerous.|Many have been consumed by the very forces they sought to control.
speak;Duessel;A sobering warning.|But you truly believe that even an old warhorse like myself could learn?|After all these years wielding steel instead of spells?
bop_portrait;Knoll
speak;Knoll;Age brings wisdom, General.|And wisdom is the foundation of true magical mastery.
bop_portrait;Knoll
speak;Knoll;Here.|This is a beginner's tome on elemental manifestation.|It's where all mages begin their journey.
speak;Duessel;You would lend me such a book?|I'm not certain what use I would have for it, but...
speak;Knoll;Try reading the first chapter before you sleep tonight.|The basic exercises require little more than concentration and breath control.
speak;Knoll;You might be surprised at what you're capable of.
speak;Duessel;Well, I suppose there's no harm in trying.|Though I must admit, I'm still skeptical.|These old hands have held weapons for decades...|I'm not sure they remember how to do much else.
speak;Knoll;The mind is more adaptable than we give it credit for, General.|Even the oldest tree can grow new branches.
expression;Duessel;Smile
bop_portrait;Duessel
speak;Duessel;Ha! A poetic sentiment.|Very well, Knoll. I accept your challenge.|I'll attempt these exercises, though I make no promises about the results.
speak;Knoll;That's all I ask.|And should you have questions, I am at your disposal.
speak;Duessel;I appreciate that.|This old dog may not learn new tricks easily...|But I've never been one to shy away from a challenge.
speak;Duessel;Who knows?|Perhaps there's a mage hiding somewhere beneath all this armor.
expression;Knoll;Smile
speak;Knoll;Perhaps indeed, General.|Perhaps indeed.
